CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 18, 1951, pg. 1, reads: "PROTEST WEBSTER AVENUE KILLINGS - Two deaths in less than four weeks proved too much for the Webster Avenue residents. They demanded Tuesday that the city take steps to put up stop signs and lights.  Left: Youngsters display signs in orderly fashion while crowd forms barrier to keep truck and cars from passing..."
TitMainTitle: Crowd, including Greta Richardson fourth from right, holding signs inscribed "Andy Jackson need not have died" and "Detour, Speedway closed for lack of lights and police protection," on Webster Avenue near Morgan Street, Hill District
